name.text: Determining the Surface Area of a cone.

questiontext.text:
Find the surface area of the solid shown in the diagram below. \(\text{Use}\, \pi= \frac{22}{7}.\)

[[jsxgraph]] const brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8, -8], axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Big circle (sphere outline), radius 7 const O = brd.create('point', [0, 0], { name: '', size: 3, fixed: true }); const sphere = brd.create('circle', [O, 5], { strokeColor: 'black' }); // Horizontal "equator" as dashed ellipse (here: circle flattened visually) const equator = brd.create('curve', [ function (t) { return 5 * Math.cos(t); }, function (t) { return 2 * Math.sin(t); }, // smaller vertical radius for ellipse look 0, 2 * Math.PI ], { strokeColor: 'blue', dash: 2 }); // Radius arrow from centre to right side const P = brd.create('point', [5, 0], {name: '', fixed: true, visible: false}); const radiusSeg = brd.create('segment', [O, P], { strokeColor: 'black', lastArrow: true }); // Label r = 7 cm slightly above the radius brd.create('text', [2, 0.6, ' {#r#} cm'], { anchorX: 'left', anchorY: 'middle' }); [[/jsxgraph]]

\(\text{Total surface area}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
The solid shown in the diagram is a sphere.

Step 1: Formula

The surface area of a sphere is given by:
\( \text{Surface area} = 4\pi r^2 \)

Step 2: Substitute values

From the diagram, the radius is \( r = {@r@} \) cm and \( \pi = \dfrac{22}{7} \).

\( \begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= 4 \pi r^2\\ &= 4 \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@r@}^2 \\ &=4 \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@r@} \times {@r@} \\ &= 4 \times {@A_1@}\\ &={@A@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

Therefore,
\( \begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= {@A@}\ \text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The radius of the sphere}={@r@}\, \text{cm}\)

\(\text{The Total surface area of the sphere}={@A@}\, \text{cm}^2\)
